sentences.english: Soon, the Civil Administration was renamed the northern part of Guangdong Shaoguan area.
sentences.chinese: 不久，粤北行政公署改称韶关专区。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, grow with respect to its force , should change probably call its " strange animal " .
sentences.chinese: 不过，就其成长力而言，或许应改称其为“怪兽”。

sentences.english: Has renamed to the Qing Dynasty as too with the palace.
sentences.chinese: 到了清代改称为太和殿。

sentences.english: Japan seized Ryukyu in 1879 and changed its name to Okinawa Prefecture.
sentences.chinese: 1879年，日本吞并琉球并改称冲绳县。

sentences.english: The Philippines just demanded the South China Sea be called "the Philippine Sea.
sentences.chinese: 菲律宾只是要求将南中国海改称为“菲律宾海”。

sentences.english: Junji the first year of the Qing Dynasty changed its name Wei Jingyuan, Yongzheng was renamed eight years Jingyuan County.
sentences.chinese: 清代顺治元年更名靖远卫，雍正八年改称靖远县。

sentences.english: But now, on many formal occasions, people use the phrase "differently abled".
sentences.chinese: 现在，在许多严肃场合改称为“不同能力的人”。

sentences.english: However, Hyun Song taboo words, which was renamed Zhenwu.
sentences.chinese: 但宋朝忌讳玄字，因而改称真武。

definition: old term/old way of referring to sth
to be generally referred to (as)/generic term
also known as/alternative name/to also be called
official name of a nation (includes dynastic names of China: 漢|汉[Han4], 唐[Tang2] etc)
